We have no choice but to accept

As the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ election begins, the people are all too keenly aware that the nation exists in a state of war. Debates in $CAPITAL$ rage over the state of the war, though the overwhelming feeling is that now more than ever citizens should be supporting the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government. Still, there are some who believe that now is the perfect time for change.
We must maintain stability even in a time of war.

As the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ election begins, there is a general sense that things are not going to proceed smoothly. A sense of change is in the air, and while not everyone wants that change it seems there are many who have leapt upon the election as a chance to make it happen. A recent riot in $CAPITAL$ was only barely kept under control, and debates elsewhere in $COUNTRY$ are threatening to erupt into further violence as neither side is willing to budge.

$COUNTRY$ has its share of problems-and as the current election gets underway, there is a sense among many that the current government is to blame. Justified or not, that anger has instilled a sense that a regime change may be in the offing. Those who previously had never considered voting for any other party than the one in power are now considering doing just that.

As the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ election gets underway, it becomes clear it will be a contentious one. The issues are clear and the battle lines between parties drawn, and there are those who believe that while violence may not be the result the toppling of the current $COUNTRY_ADJ$ regime could be.

With the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ election underway, supporters of the current regime have rallied in $CAPITAL$. They claim that stability is required to deal with the problems facing $COUNTRY$, and are actively trying to shout down opposition. Whether this will mean a victory in the current election is unknown.

The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ election is underway, and so far, it has proceeded smoothly. Debates are being carried out in the usual manner, and there are no reports of violence in $CAPITAL$ or elsewhere. Supporters of the ruling regime have turned out in force, as have the hopefuls seeking to defeat the current government.

The country is baffled as the election is announced, did we just had one? People are starting to question our democratic process, one election after the other until the side the government wants to win wins?
The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ election has ended, with the leader of the conservative party declaring victory from the steps of the presidential palace in $CAPITAL$.
The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ election has ended, with the leader of the socialist party declaring victory from the steps of the presidential palace in $CAPITAL$.
The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ election has ended, with the leader of the liberal party declaring victory from the steps of the presidential palace in $CAPITAL$.
The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ election has ended, with the leader of the communist party declaring victory from the steps of the presidential palace in $CAPITAL$.
The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ election has ended, with the leader of the fascist party declaring victory from the steps of the presidential palace in $CAPITAL$.
The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ election has ended, with the leader of the reactionary party declaring victory from the steps of the presidential palace in $CAPITAL$.
The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ election has ended, with the leader of the anarcho-liberal party declaring victory from the steps of the presidential palace in $CAPITAL$.

Now that a true Jewish homeland has been established, Israel will begin to draw many Jewish people who live in countries across the world-though this will inevitably anger many neighbouring Islamic countries who object to its presence.
We welcome all who wish to come.

Jewish families in $PROVINCENAME$, having originally arrived in $COUNTRY$ as a result of the diaspora, are reportedly planning on emigrating to Israel-the newly-established Jewish homeland in the Palestine. We could encourage them to remain, but that might not be a simple matter.
Whoever wishes to go may leave.

There has been an increasing desire among the people of $COUNTRY$ to gain our full independence. Crowds gathering in $CAPITAL$ have demanded an end to rule by our distant overlords, and while many in the government are sympathetic with their cries there are also those who fear such a demand could lead to war. Any attempts to achieve independence should ideally take a diplomatic route first, with friendly ties maintained if peaceful separation becomes a reality.

Diplomats from $FROMCOUNTRY$ arrived in $CAPITAL$ this month, presenting a formal request for their full independence from $COUNTRY$. They assure us that they fully intend to maintain ties with our nation, and have agreed to move forward as $COUNTRY_ADJ$ allies, but that they desire their freedom even so. There are many who feel such a request is beyond the pale and must be refused out of hand. Still others say that if $FROMCOUNTRY$ is denied, we could be facing a rebellion-and is it not better than to have a friendly ally than a recalcitrant and unwilling subject?
Not unexpectedly, the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has denied our request for independence. It seems our only option is rebellion-as unrealistic as some claim that option to be.

Our diplomacy has proven successful: $COUNTRY$ has been granted full autonomy, on the condition that friendly ties be maintained with $FROMCOUNTRY$. Crowds have gathered in $CAPITAL$ to cheer on our Independence Day!
It appears the threat of a war of independence was enough to secure $COUNTRY$’s freedom. Crowds have gathered in $CAPITAL$ to cheer on our Independence Day!
It appears the time for diplomacy has ended. We have received word from the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government that they have demanded independence-or it will be war.
We shall let them go. For now.

Since $COUNTRY$ was denied its independence, there has been talk of open rebellion in the streets of $CAPITAL$. Fighting against our overlords might surely result in us being crushed, however. Since we have no recourse, secretly approaching some of the enemies of our overlord might gain us some allies in the war to come.
There is no need for this.

Representatives from $FROMCOUNTRY$ have quietly approached us, asking to set up an alliance with $COUNTRY$ should their demand for independence go unheeded. So far, they say, diplomatic efforts have proven fruitless... so $COUNTRY_ADJ$ assistance would be invaluable to them, and perhaps gain us a new ally.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has agreed to our secret alliance. Whether they will indeed help once the war begins remains to be seen.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has refused our request. Hopefully they don't inform our overlords of our intent.

A group of liberal intellectuals known as the ‘Young Ottomans’, led by the statesman reformer Midhat Pasha and influenced by the Liberal Revolutions elsewhere in Europe, have proposed a new constitution—the ‘Kanûn-u Esâsî’ or ‘Basic Law’—which would see an elected parliament created, would limit the powers of the Sultan, and speed up the Tanzimat Reforms. Conservative members of the Ottoman government claim that giving into these liberals will only speed up the erosion of long-held traditions, while others say that the reforms are sorely needed to stave off the decline of the Empire at the hands of nationalists.

The current state of unrest within the Empire has reached the point where the Sultan has been advised to abrogate the Ottoman Constitution. Absolute power must be returned to the monarchy in order to stamp out the militants-and while there are those who say that such action will only foster more unrest, there are others who are all too aware that failing to do so will make the Sultan look weak. It is not beyond the realm of possibility that reactionaries might seek to restore the monarchy by force-or, even worse, seek to abolish it altogether.
Order must be restored. Abrogate the constitution.
Reform must move forward, no matter the cost.

With the recent loss of European territories, nationalists within $COUNTRY$ have been inspired to rise up. $COUNTRY_ADJ$ officials are concerned we could be seeing a string of rebellions in the years to come, and already the army is scrambling to contain any efforts at rebel organization.

Spurred on by the continuing lack of reform, Ottoman liberals have radicalized into the ‘Young Turks’. They seek to restore the constitutional monarchy, by force if need be, and there are those who have advised the government that these liberals must be dealt with harshly before they grow into a real problem.
We cannot allow them to spread unrest.

Turkish liberals have grown increasingly defiant of the Ottoman monarchy-to the point where they suggest that the Sultan must be overthrown, replaced with a modern republic. They reject the notion of Ottomanism, saying it has already led to the Empire’s decline, and that the way to restoring the nation’s glory is to put the good of the Turkish people ahead of all other concerns... including religious.

The Ottoman monarchy has been overthrown, and now $COUNTRY$ stands in its place. The concept of Ottomanism, an Empire formed of diverse cultures and religions, has been set aside in favour of a nation built by and for the Turkish people.

With the loss of many wars, its status of a Great Power, and finally, loss of the City of Constantinople, The Sick Man of Europe is finally layed to rest. Army has collapsed, there is chaos everywhere and various ethnicities and factions have risen up and taken over in the power vacuum that ensued. The concept of Ottomanism has collapsed and its stead a nation built by and for the Turkish people attempts to live on.
Collapse of the Sick Man of Europe
These are dire times for our country

The Imams of Yemen are religiously consecrated leaders belonging to the Zaidiyyah branch of Shia Islam. They established a blend of religious and secular rule in parts of Yemen in 897 and now the Rassid dynasty ruled for almost a millennium. However, the power of the imamate declined in the 18th and 19th century. The territory controlled by the imams shrank successively after the late 17th century, and the lucrative coffee trade declined with new producers in other parts of the world. The imamate became a ‘quasi-state’ with an inherent tension between tribes and government, and between tribal culture and learned Islamic morality. The imams themselves adopted the style of Middle East monarchies, becoming increasingly distant figures. As a result, they lost their charismatic and spiritual position among the tribes of Yemen. These recent developments made this the ideal moment to reassert our dominance over the highlands of Yemen.
The Fate of the Zaydi Imamate
We will drive the Rassids out of Yemen.
Let’s seize the moment and declare war.

The Kingdom of the Shilluk people declined over the years and now only their capital remains. They are backwards and would be easy prey and we already conquered much of their territory in the past. It’s time to end our conquest of their territory.
Let it go. They are harmless.

‘In the beginning, the first Senussi went to Mecca, where he joined Ahmad Ibn Idris al-Fasi, the head of the Khadirites. Due to Wahhabi pressure, Senussi left Mecca and settled in Cyrenaica in 1843, where in the mountains near Sidi Rafaa’ he built the Zawia Baida (White Monastery).’ The Senussi are a Muslim political-religious Sufi order and tribe in Cyrenaica. They claim a direct lineage to the Prophet Muhammad and are concerned with both the decline of Islamic thought and spirituality and the weakening of Muslim political integrity. The power of the current Grand Senussi, Sayyid Muhammad al-Mahdi bin Sayyid Muhammad as-Senussi, grew to the point that it made the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ regime uneasy. In $YEAR$, he moved farther from direct $COUNTRY_ADJ$ surveillance to Jaghbub, where he has the authority of a sovereign in a vast but almost empty desert.
He thinks he can run from $COUNTRY$?

The Mahdists in Sudan held Khartoum for months and their insurrection raged in Sudan. After our failure to put them down, they are declaring independence and forming a new fundamentalist state in Sudan.

The lack of formal authority in South Sudan, which was claimed by Egypt, was filled in the 1850s by a set of powerful merchant princes. In the east Muhammad Ahmad al-Aqqad controlled much land, but the most powerful was Al-Zubayr Rahma Mansur who came to control the Bahr el Ghazal and other parts of South Sudan. Al-Zubayr was a merchant from Khartoum, who hired his own private army and marched south. He set up a network of trading forts known as zaribas through the region, and from these forts controlled local trade. To manage the trade al-Zubayr needed labour, and thus also began to capture a significant number of slaves. To his mercenary force he conscripted a large slave army.
We need to put up with him for now.

The area known as the Bahr el Ghazal in South Sudan had long been the source of the goods that Darfur would trade to Egypt and North Africa, especially slaves and ivory. The natives of Bahr el Ghazal paid tribute to Darfur, and these were the chief articles of merchandise sold by the Furs to the Egyptian traders along the road to Asyut. Al-Zubayr redirected this flow of goods to Khartoum and the Nile with his conquest of South Sudan. Now, Sultan Ibrahim of Darfur insulted and challenged al-Zubayr who allied himself with his former enemies the Egyptians.
The King of Fur and the King of Slaves
After the Egyptians withdrew from the Yemeni seaboard in 1841, Haj Ali Shermerki, a successful and ambitious Somali merchant, is offering to purchase executive rights over Zeila.

For long, the seat of Metropolitan of Montenegro has been de facto a hereditary position. The Metropolitan would rule Montenegro, the small but de facto independent state surrounded by the Ottoman Empire. The last Metropolitan, Petar II Petrovic Njegos, before his death he named his nephew Danilo as his successor. When Njegos died, the Senate, under influence of Djordjije Petrovic, proclaimed Njegos’s elder brother Pero Tomov Petrovic as Prince and not Vladika. Nevertheless, in a brief struggle for power, Pero Tomov, who commanded the support of the Senate, lost to the much younger Danilo who had more support among the people. In $YEAR$ Danilo proclaimed the secular Principality of Montenegro with himself as Prince and formally abolished theocracy.
The Fall of the Metropolitan Regime
The Prince-Bishopric will remain as it is.

The call from $FROMCOUNTRY$ has come to $COUNTRY$, asking us to unify with their nation into a greater state-one which will forge a greater power in a new world order. There are those $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens who fear losing our identity in such a union, but many welcome the nation and rightly state that $FROMCOUNTRY$’s influence in $COUNTRY$ is already great. If we deny the union, the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government may decide to enforce their claim on us whether we like it or not.
We have no interest in becoming part of $FROMCOUNTRY$.
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ ambassador has delivered a message: $FROMCOUNTRY$ will not join $COUNTRY$.
Then we shall claim them by force.
We have no plans to integrate $FROMCOUNTRY$ forcibly.

We may now proceed to propose the union to other local governments with full confidence that both our governments are behind it.

We can ignore their refusal and proceed with the federation anyhow, but not without upsetting the Hungarian people greatly.

Support the Qing! Destroy the Foreign!’ \n \n Many Chinese are growing enraged at the continuing encroachment of westerners into the Empire. They walk freely, spread Christianity with impunity, and ignore Imperial laws. A movement called the Righteous Harmony Society-known to foreigners as ‘Boxers’-has appeared, their mission to drive western influence out of the Qing Empire by any means necessary. Some are worried that attacks upon westerners could bring foreign anger down upon us, but there are those who see this as a good thing. Anger against westerners, even if it means a degree of chaos and disruption in our provinces, means support for the Qing government.
We shall remain silent... for now.

An attack upon a foreign merchant in $PROVINCENAME$ has signalled the arrival of the Boxer movement to $STATENAME$. Already the flags of the Righteous Harmony Society have been spotted, their followers recruiting fellow Chinese to support the Qing government in their struggle.

Throughout all of $STATENAME$, the Boxers are attacking western influence. Smugglers, missionaries, opium peddlers... anyone they can apprehend is being slain or forced to flee for their lives. We have a choice: either look the other way, risking anger from the great powers for these ‘atrocities’, or send in forces to suppress the Boxers and risk the anger of our own people.
Suppress them. The westerners must not be harmed.

A group of Chinese nationalists known as the ‘Boxers’, intent on driving all western influence out of $FROMCOUNTRY$, have attacked a group of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens. Several were slain, while others were forced to flee for their lives. Worse, the Qing government has done nothing about it. They are looking the other way while these atrocities are being committed upon our people.

The Boxers have reached the capital of $COUNTRY$, streaming into $CAPITAL$ to attack foreigners-and, far more noteworthy, they have laid siege to the Legation Quarter. Hundreds of foreign dignitaries and merchants reside within. If we do not step in to protect them, it will be seen as a declaration of support for the Boxers and an act of war against the great powers. If we do, the Boxers will see it as a betrayal of their cause and perhaps even rise up in rebellion against us. They have forced our hand now, however, and we have no choice but to act.

The Boxer situation in $FROMCOUNTRY$ has reached a head: the Chinese nationalists have entered Peking, laying siege to the Legation Quarter and putting the lives of dozens of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ merchants and dignitaries at risk. The Qing government has looked the other way, an act that is seen by the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government as a declaration of war. Many are calling upon us to intervene in order to protect $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens from these barbarians.

We are forced to submit to the foreign demands, signing a treaty with the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ generals and representatives from all the great powers. The Righteous Harmony Society will be forcibly disbanded, its leaders executed or imprisoned, and our government is once again humiliated.

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has submitted to the intervening powers, signing a treaty that promises to forcibly dismantle the Boxers and pay reparations for the atrocities committed in their name-and explicitly supported by the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government.

 He negotiated an agreement with Wazir Akbar Khan, by which his army was to fall back to Jalalabad, more than 90 miles away. However the Afghans launched numerous attacks against the column as it made slow progress through the Hindu Kush. In total the British lost 4,500 troops, along with about 12,000 civilians: the latter comprising both the families of Indian and British soldiers, plus other Indian camp-followers. 
 
 Out of more than 16,000 people from the column commanded by Elphinstone, only one European (Assistant Surgeon William Brydon) and a few Indian sepoys reached Jalalabad.

After the Anglo-Sikh war, the city of Multan was governed by Dewan Mulraj, who behaved independently and often resisted British authority. When he was required by the British to pay an increased tax assessment and revenues which were in arrears, Mulraj attempted to give up power to his son, so as to maintain his family’s position as rulers. Instead he was to be replaced by, Sardar Kahan Singh, along with a British liaison, Lieutenant Patrick Vans Agnew. 
 
 When Vans Agnew’s Party arrived in Multan, Mulraj handed over the keys of the fortress, but as they attempted to take possession, they were attacked by Mulraj’s troops and murdered by a city mob. 
 
 In a short time the Sikh troops and sardars in the city had joined in open rebellion.
Order in Punjab must be restored!

By $YEAR$, a citizen of San Francisco called Joshua Abraham Norton had become completely discontented with what he considered the inadequacies of the legal and political structures of the Californian Republic. He took matters into his own hands and distributed letters to the various newspapers in the city, proclaiming himself "Emperor of California" (he later added "Protector of Mexico" to this title). The announcement was first printed for humorous effect by the editor of the San Francisco Daily Evening Bulletin. Norton issued numerous decrees on matters of the state, including a decree to formally abolish the Congress.
Maybe he is right, what we need is an Emperor. Norton shall take charge!

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have come to us with a proposal to recognise $COUNTRY_ADJ$ sovereignty over the region of the Mosquito Coast, but will reserve, on the basis of historical rights, a self-governing enclave for the Miskito, an indigenous group in the area. The provisions of the treaty would be:
 
 1. Sovereignty over the Mosquito Coast belongs to $COUNTRY$, but the autonomy of the Miskito is guaranteed.
 2. $COUNTRY$ has the right to fly its flag in any part of the Mosquito Coast.
 3. $COUNTRY$ would maintain a Commissioner on the Mosquito Coast to defend her national interests.
 4. $COUNTRY$ would not make concessions to the exploitation of natural resources in the Mosquito Coast. That right alone corresponded to the Miskito government.
 5. $COUNTRY$ cannot regulate Miskito’s trade tax, nor its importations nor exportations.
 6. $COUNTRY$ would pay a compensation to the Miskito king.
We shall take the Mosquito Coast by force!

The last member of the Federalists, Grisons, surrendered last week bringing the war to an end. The federal army had lost 78 men killed and had 260 wounded. Sonderbund losses were even lower. In Bern the liberal government was dissolved and a new provisional government protecting the old constitution established.The old Swiss Confederal Constitution protects the almost-complete independence of the cantons and at least for now prevents Switzerland from transforming into a federal state.

The last member of the Sonderbund, Valais, surrendered last week bringing the war to an end. The federal army had lost 78 men killed and had 260 wounded. Sonderbund losses were even lower. In Schwyz the conservative government was dissolved and a new provisional government and constitution established.\nThe first attempt at a constitution, which split the district of Schwyz in two and moved the cantonal capital away from Schwyz, was narrowly defeated. The second constitution, which removed the mentioned points and merged the former districts of Wollerau and Pfäffikon in the district of March, was then approved by the electorate. The new constitution of $YEAR$ reformed the government of the Canton. Perhaps the greatest change was that it abolished the Landsgemeinde, which had formerly been the supreme authority. It split the government into three branches, legislature, executive and judiciary and created a three-tier structure of municipalities, districts and canton. It created proportional representation and allowed the population to vote on laws and constitutional amendments.\nThe new Swiss Federal Constitution ended the almost-complete independence of the cantons and transformed Switzerland into a federal state.
The End of the Sonderbund War

In $YEAR$, seven cantons-Lucerne, Fribourg, Valais, Uri, Schwyz, Unterwalden and Zug, all predominantly Catholic and governed by Conservative administrations formed the Sonderbund (‘separate alliance’). The cantons of Ticino and Solothurn, also predominantly Catholic but governed by liberal administrations, did not join the alliance. \n \n The Sonderbund was in violation of the Federal Treaty of 1815, Section 6 of which expressly forbade such separate alliances, and the liberal majority in the Tagsatzung decided to dissolve the Sonderbund on October 21, 1847. The confederate army was raised against the members of the Sonderbund. The army was composed of soldiers of all the other cantons except Neuchatel and Appenzell Innerrhoden (which remained neutral).

The word ‘coolie’ is believed to have come from the Hindi term kuli, which is also the name of a native tribe of Gujarat in western India.

Between 1793 and 1850 nearly 200,000 free settlers and assisted immigrants chose to migrate to Australia to start a new life. The majority were English agricultural workers or domestic servants who outnumbered the Irish and Scottish migrants.

The California Gold Rush began on $YEAR$, when gold was found by James W. Marshall at Sutter’s Mill in Coloma, California. The first to hear confirmed information of the gold rush were the people in Oregon, the Sandwich Islands (Hawaii), and Latin America, and they were the first to start flocking to the state in late $YEAR$. \n \n All in all, the news of gold brought some 300,000 people to California from the rest of the United States and abroad. Of the 300,0, approximately half arrived by sea and half came overland on the California Trail and the Gila River trail.
There’s gold in them thar hills!

An uprising of several hundred revolutionaries, funded by revolutionaries living in Malaya attempted an uprising in the Guangdong and Guangxi provinces. Although initially successful, Qing reinforcements quickly turned the battle into a catastrophic defeat for the revolutionaries, killing most of them. Revolutionary leader Huang Xing was wounded during the battle-he lost one of his fingers when it was hit by a bullet. \n \n The dead were mostly youths with all kinds of social backgrounds, former students, teachers, journalists, and oversea Chinese. Some of them were of high rank in the Alliance. Before the battle, most of the revolutionaries knew that the battle would probably be lost, since they were heavily outnumbered, but they went into battle anyway. The mission was carried out like that of a suicide squad. Their letters to their loved ones were later found.

On his return to Germany from his 1879-1882 Pacific expedition, Otto Finsch joined a small, informal group interested in German colonial expansion into the South Seas led by the banker, Adolph von Hansemann. Finsch encouraged them to pursue the founding of a colony on the north-east coast of New Guinea and the New Britain Archipelago even providing them with an estimate of the costs of such a venture.
Claim Northern New Guinea as a $COUNTRY_ADJ$ colony!
We have no interest in this.

It is with much grief that I feel myself obliged to communicate to your Excellency a dreadful event which has happened to me, and as an English subject to beg your protection. Last Sunday, Easter-day, at about 12 o’clock, a crowd of people, presented themselves at the door of my house, which they very soon battered down. These brigands, in number about 300 or 400, entered my house, and began beating my wife and my innocent children. After having broken every article of furniture, they robbed me of every valuable in my possession.
Civis romanus sum! Any British subject shall feel safe in foreign lands!
Civil matters of our subjects in foreign lands do not concern us.

Apparently, the former Portuguese Consul Don Pacifico was attacked by a mob in his home and in an act of pure arrogance, the British have demanded a compensation be paid to this man, of which the valuation of his losses are worth more than the Royal Place in Athens! Our pride dictates that we cannot give in to these absurd claims, but to not do so might incur the wrath of the mighty Royal Navy.
Oxi. The Greek people will not be insulted like this.
It seems we have no choice.

I have desired the Admiralty to instruct Sir William Parker to take Athens on his way back from the Dardanelles, and to support you in bringing at last to a satisfactory ending the settlement of our various claims upon the Greek Government. If however, the Greek Government does not strike, Parker must do so. In that case you should embark on board his fleet before he begins to take any hostile steps, in order that you and your mission may be secure against insult. He should, of course, begin by reprisals, that is, by taking possession of some Greek property, but the King would probably not much care for our taking hold of any merchant property, and the best thing, therefore, would be to seize hold of his little fleet, if that can be done handily. The next thing would be a blockade of any or all of his ports....-Lord Palmerston, Foreign Secretary
This is madness, we will not risk war over such petty matters.

The Greek Government has agreed to pay full compensation to both Don Pacifico and the Portuguese government for their losses. Although the other great powers disapprove of our heavy-handed methods of diplomacy, any British subject, in whatever land he may be, shall feel confident that the watchful eye and the strong arm of England will protect him from injustice and wrong!

A British fleet has appeared off our shores and has seized several of our warships, this is an act of humiliation to the Greek people! The French and the Prussians are calling for us to resist the British Blockade, but have not guaranteed any military support. My King, if we give in to the British, it will damage our prestige immeasurably, but if we do not, there is a very real likelihood of a war we cannot win.
It seems we have no choice.

The Guangxu Emperor was the eleventh emperor of the Qing dynasty, and the ninth Qing emperor to rule over China, during much of his rule, was constantly hampered by Empress Dowager Cixi’s strong influence over the conservatives in the Qing Court. His regnal name, ‘Guangxu’, means ‘glorious succession’. \n Throughout his reign, the Guangxu Emperor came to believe that by learning from constitutional monarchies like Japan, the Qing Empire would become more politically and economically powerful. However, opposition from traditionalist factions in China would severely hamper any attempts at real reform.

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has requested military aid from us in their conflict, while the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$s are not expecting us to intervene directly in their conflict, $COUNTRY_ADJ$ indirect military aid to them might be in both our interests. If we were to send help to the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$s, Military advisors, arms and other supplies can be shipped out immediately, and we can always make the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government pay up after the war’s over whether they are successful or not. The catch, of course, is that this could potentially escalate and drag us into the war.
We will stand by the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ people.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has come to our aid! Although it’s not a direct intervention on our side, $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ officers, arms and supplies are now available to us. Hopefully, this will bring us victory.
The answer from the $FROMCOUNTRY$ is clear: they have no interest in helping our cause, we are on our own.
Curse Them! We will fight on!
Our debts from the military supplies, arms and advisors incurred during the war must now be paid off.

The War is over and our Great Power 'ally' did not aid us in our time of need. We can either hope to turn to another great power who will help us, or perhaps we have no choice to remain aligned and maintain the status quo?
Curse them, we will go our own path!

The territories of the Left Bank of the Rhine, which French troops had conquered in 1795, had been returned to German (mostly Prussian) control after the 1815 Congress of Vienna, forming the Rhine Province. On $YEAR$, France shifted its focus to the Rhine, and the French government, led by Adolphe Thiers, restated its claim to the areas on the left bank, to re-establish the Rhine as a natural border. The French have refused to back down from their position, and we now find ourselves at the brink of war...
Let’s try to calm things down.

In the 1850s, the cities of each colony began a period of dramatic change. This transformation was due to an increased population, wealth from the gold rushes in New South Wales and Victoria and new ideas generated by a culturally diverse population. By the end of the decade, public structures and housing in Sydney and Melbourne had multiplied. Many elegant and ornate civic buildings with attractive tree-lined and paved streetscapes were built. \n \n Between 1851 and 1854, the population of Victoria grew from about 77,000 to more than 200,000. The estimated population of Australia in 1850 was approximately 400,0, but had increased to 1 million by 1860.

The Treaty of Frankfurt was signed in Frankfurt on $YEAR$, at the end of the Franco-$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ War. It established the frontier between the $COUNTRY$ and $FROMCOUNTRY$, it confirmed the succession of the region of Alsace-Lorraine and allowed residents of the region to decide between keeping their French nationality and emigrating, or remaining in the region and becoming German citizens.
 
 Another issue of the aftermath of the war the issue of the war dead lying on both French and German soil, under the Treaty of Frankfurt, the French and German governments will reciprocally agree to respect and maintain the tombs of soldiers buried on their respective territories. 
 
 French obligations under Article 16 of the Treaty of Frankfurt were laid out in the law on military tombs of 4 April 1873. Implementation involved constructing 25 large ossuaries and burying war dead of all nationalities at a total cost of over 2,0,000 francs.
Alsace-Lorraine will be ours again in time.

The Treaty of Paris was signed in Paris on $YEAR$, at the end of the Franco-$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ War. It established the frontier between the $COUNTRY$ and $FROMCOUNTRY$, it confirmed the succession of the region of Alsace-Lorraine and allowed residents of the region to decide between keeping their French nationality and emigrating, or remaining in the region and becoming $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens.
 
 Another issue of the aftermath of the war the issue of the war dead lying on both French and German soil, under the Treaty of Paris, the French and $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ governments will reciprocally agree to respect and maintain the tombs of soldiers buried on their respective territories. 
 
 French obligations under Article 16 of the Treaty of Paris were laid out in the law on military tombs of 4 April 1873. Implementation involved constructing 25 large ossuaries and burying war dead of all nationalities at a total cost of over 2,0,000 francs.

In $YEAR$, Congress narrowly passed a bill that authorized the U.S. to annex the Republic of Texas if it so voted. The legislation set the date for annexation for the end of the same year. A majority of voters in Texas approved a proposed constitution that specifically endorsed slavery and the slave trade. This constitution was later accepted by the U.S. Congress, making Texas a state on the same day annexation took effect, therefore bypassing a territorial phase \n \n The Mexican government had long warned that annexation would mean war with the U.S. When Texas joined the U.S., the Mexican government broke diplomatic relations with the United States. The U.S. now assumed the claims of Texas when it claimed all land north of the Rio Grande. In $YEAR$ President James K. Polk sent General Zachary Taylor to Texas, soon 3,500 Americans were on the Nueces River, prepared to defend Texas from a Mexican invasion.
Another glorious day for the Union!

In the mid-to-late 19th century, the Chinese Qing Empire weakened substantially and became increasingly unable to support the Lanfang Republic as its vassal state. Thus, Lanfang Republic’s vigorous development suffered from the eventual expansion of the Dutch. The Republic’s citizenry waged a tenacious resistance, but ultimately failed due to poor weaponry. Many of Lanfang’s citizens and their descendants made their way to Sumatra or Singapore.

Georges Ernest Jean-Marie Boulanger, nicknamed General Revanche, was a French officer who was noted for his bravery and leadership during the Franco-Prussian War and was among the leaders of the Third Republic who crushed the short-lived Paris Commune. \n \n With backing from his direct superior, Henri d’Orleans, duc d’Aumale (incidentally, one of the sons of former king Louis-Philippe), Boulanger was made a brigadier-general and in $YEAR$ was appointed director of infantry at the war office. His base of support and popularity comes from the working districts of Paris and other cities, plus rural traditionalist Catholics and royalists, however he was initially seen as a Republican. He is noted for an aggressive form of nationalism, known as Revanchism, which opposes The German Empire and calls for the defeat of the Franco-Prussian War to be avenged.

After Georges Boulanger was recalled from the command of the army in North Africa, he returned to Paris, and began to take part in politics under the aegis of Georges Clemenceau and the Radicals. \n \n In $YEAR$, when Charles de Freycinet was brought into power, Clemenceau used his influence to secure Boulanger’s appointment as War Minister. Clemenceau assumed Boulanger was a republican, because he was known not to attend Mass.

In $YEAR$, the French Havas news agency published a dispatch to the effect that Guillaume Schnaebele, a mid-level and obscure French police inspector, had been arrested by two agents of the German secret police on the Franco-German frontier near Pagny-sur-Moselle, as he was travelling for a meeting with the German police inspector there, at the latter’s request. A dispute followed as to whether the arrest had taken place on French or on German territory, but regardless, under the circumstances Schnaebele is entitled to immunity even if on German territory, since he had been invited to a conference by German officials. 
 
 The reason given for the arrest was that in a previous inquiry, evidence had been produced that Schnaebele was involved in transmitting information as to German fortresses, furnished by Alsatians in the pay of the French Government, in other words, the Germans believe Schnaebelé to be a spy. 
 
 What should the response of the French Government be?
Demand the Germans release Schnaebele immediately!
It’s time to reclaim Alsace-Lorraine! To War!
We must not antagonize the Germans.

In $YEAR$, the French Havas news agency published a dispatch to the effect that Guillaume Schnaebele, a mid-level and obscure French police inspector, had been arrested by two agents of the German secret police on the Franco-German frontier near Pagny-sur-Moselle, as he was on his way to Ars-sur-Moselle for a meeting with the German police inspector there, at the latter’s request. A dispute followed as to whether the arrest had taken place on French or on German territory, but regardless, the French claim Schnaebele is entitled to immunity even if on German territory, since he had been invited to a conference by German officials. 
 
 It is suspected by German officials that Schnaebelé had been spying on German border fortresses for the French Government, however the circumstances behind his arrest may put us in a negative light despite of the proofs of guilt. 
 
 What should our response to the French be?
It’s just a meeting between frontier officials, release him
We will not release the spy, even if it means war.

Within a week of his arrest, Schnaebelé was released by order of the German Emperor William I. Although the German Government considered, in view of the proofs of guilt, the arrest to be fully justified, it was deemed expedient to release Schnaebelé on the ground that business meetings between frontier officials ‘must always be regarded as protected by a mutually-assured safe conduct.’ 
 
 Although many in France believe Bismarck backed down because he was afraid of Boulanger, the French Army is no better off than it was during the Franco-Prussian War. 
 
 There is now question on what to do with Boulanger, with many within the government to have him sacked.
Boulanger must be removed from office.

Daniel Wilson, son-in-law of the sitting President Jules Grevy, has been caught selling Legion d’honneur medals for his own personal gain public outcry for his arrest and for Jules Grevy to resign. \n \n During this period, General Boulanger was in Switzerland, where he met with Jerome Napoleon Bonaparte II, technically a Bonapartist, who offered his full support to the cause. The Bonapartists had attached themselves to the general, and even the Comte de Paris encouraged his followers to support him. Once seen as a republican, Boulanger shows his true colours in the camp of the conservative monarchists. In $MONTH$, $YEAR$ Boulanger was expelled from the army and the day after, Daniel Wilson had his imprisonment repealed. It seemed to the French people that honourable generals were punished while corrupt politicians were spared, further increasing Boulanger’s popularity.
The next few months could prove turbulent for the Third Republic...

In the elections of $YEAR$, Boulanger ran as a deputy for Paris, and, after an intense campaign, took the seat with 244,000 votes against the 160,000 of his main adversary. A coup d’état seems probable and desirable among his supporters. How should the next few days proceed?
We must act quickly! Secret societies must be banned from France!
There will not be a coup, there is nothing to worry about.

Had Boulanger immediately placed himself at the head of a revolt he might have affected the coup which many of his partisans had worked for, and might even have governed France, but the opportunity passed with his procrastination on $MONTH$. According to Lady Randolph Churchill ‘all his thoughts were centred in and controlled by her who was the mainspring of his life. After the plebiscite...he rushed off to Madame Bonnemain’s house and could not be found’. 
 
 Boulanger decided that it would be better to contest the general election and take power legally. This gave his enemies the time they needed to strike back, and activities of secret societies were soon forbidden and banned.
 
 Shortly afterward the government issued a warrant for Boulanger’s arrest for conspiracy and treasonable activity. To the astonishment of his supporters, he fled Paris before it could be executed, going first to Brussels and then to London.
The Republic is safe from Boulangists at last.

Acting quickly, Georges Boulanger and his supporters have launched a coup in Paris, seizing control of the country and dissolving the Third Republic. Now the question is whether to install Boulanger as President for Life of the Fourth Republic or to Restore the French Monarchy?
The Orléanist Monarchy will be restored!
Onwards to the Third French Empire!

We have received a formal request from the Qing Government for $COUNTRY_ADJ$ military intervention against the Taiping Rebellion, which has wreaked havoc throughout China. In the aftermath of the Second Opium War, although the Treaty of Peking have given us very favourable terms, those terms are of little use if the Qing government collapses. \n \n Furthermore, there have also been reports that the rebels are threatening our treaty ports and legations. We must act with haste to put an end to the rebellion and restore order to China.
Our interests in the Far East must be protected.
We have no interest in Chinese internal affairs.

In the southern province of Guizhou, The Miaotze, having taken advantage of the Panthay rebellion in neighbouring Yunnan and the Taiping rebellion, have risen up in revolt against Han Chinese rule. The Qing Government must swiftly deal with this insurrection.

With $COUNTRY_ADJ$ forces marching into Guiyang, the Miao Rebellion is officially over. The Miaotze rebels and their leaders have been crushed. Many of the Miao people have been slaughtered by our forces, and their fighting spirit has been crushed.

The Battle of Cau Giay or Paper Bridge, one of the numerous clashes of the French expedition to Tonkin against Liu Yongfu’s Black Flag Army has resulted in defeat. A small force under the command of capitaine de vaisseau Henri Riviere attacked a strong Black Flag defensive position near the village of Cau Giay a few miles to the west of Hanoi, aslo known as Paper Bridge (Pont de Papier). \n \n After initial successes, the expedition forces were eventually enveloped on both wings, and were only with difficulty able to regroup and fall back to Hanoi. Riviere and several other senior officers were killed in the action.
France will avenge her glorious children!

Opposition to the reforms implemented by the Guangxu Emperor and his reformers was intense among the conservative ruling elite, who, condemning the announced reform as too radical, proposed instead a more moderate and gradualist course of change. \n \n With the tacit support of the political opportunist Yuan Shikai and the backing of conservatives, Empress Dowager Cixi engineered a coup d’état on $MONTH$, $YEAR$, forcing the young, reform-minded Guangxu into seclusion. The emperor has been put under house arrest within the Summer Palace. Cixi shall take over the Imperial government as regent.

The Qing Empire is currently attempting to modernize it’s military with the establishment of a modern ocean-going battlefleet and has placed an order of several warships. \n \n Taking this order would certainly prove the capability of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ naval construction to other powers.
Qing Empire Places Naval Ships Order
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has accepted the payment for the ships to be constructed for the Beiyang Fleet and have begun construction on the warships. We will have to wait some time before the ships are ready.
The Northern Seas Fleet will be grand!
The ships of the Beiyang Fleet have been completed and delivered to our Navy, this is a glorious day for the Qing Empire!
May they serve us well in battle.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has declared war in an attempt to restore the deposed Republican government. This will be a fight to the death for our socialist revolution!

Now that the war is over and the Southern provinces are now once again under Dutch rule, the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$s have been quick to pressure us to follow our obligations. Under the Treaty of Amsterdam, the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg will be ruled under personal union with the Kingdom of the Netherlands under the House of Orange-Nassau, and shall join the German Customs Union. \n \n Should we defy the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$s, we would risk a second war...
We shall honour the terms of the treaty
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has established a protectorate over our nation

In $YEAR$, The Texan war for independence finally ended, and the country was able to assert itself as an independent state that can forge its own future. We must now try to recover from the war, and find a place for ourselves in the balance between the United States and Mexico.
We'll never surrender, and ever with liberty be

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$s are offering that in return for $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ military assistance in the successful restoration of control in the Southern provinces, that Luxembourg shall be granted autonomy and shall join the German Customs Union (Zollverein), ruled under personal union with the Kingdom of the Netherlands by the House of Orange-Nassau. 
 
 My King, should we accept their offer? 
 
 Â§R(NOTE: You will have to declare war against Belgium again if you refuse.)
We shall agree to the Prussian offer

We are forced to submit to the foreign demands, signing a treaty with the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats, our armies lay scattered and destroyed and whatever territory the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ controlled has been returned to the Manchu. This is a devastating blow to our Heavenly Kingdom.
Our righteous cause will continue regardless.
Western forces have been immensely successful in their fight against the Taiping rebels, however it is up to our own armies to end this devastating war. Nanjing will fall!
Onwards! Crush whatever remains of Hong Xiuquan rebellion!

Kill the Rich and Aid the Poor!’\n \n After the Yellow River floods, widespread devastation across the Northern Anhui and Henan regions. Due to the recent war with the British and the ongoing fighting against the Taiping Rebellion, aid to the region was minimal and ineffective. This enraged the Nian movement, which blamed the Europeans for contributing to China’s troubles, and increasingly viewed the Qing government as incompetent and cowardly in the face of the Western powers.
These bandits will be crushed in time.

In $YEAR$, after the Yellow River had burst once again, ineffective government aid drove many of the displaced people to join the Nian Militias. Seizing the opportunity, Zhang Lexing, the leader of the Nian movement, took direct action by launching attacks against government troops in central China. \n \n Another rebellion in China had begun.

The Nian used the ‘Five Element Banner Army system’, based on the earlier White Lotus uprisings, the banners were coloured Green, Red, Black, White & Yellow. 
 
 Qing forces were badly overstretched due to other rebellions across China, allowing the Nian armies to conquer large tracts of land and gain control over economically vital areas. The Nian fortified their captured cities and used them as bases to launch cavalry attacks against Qing troops in the countryside, prompting local towns to fortify themselves against Nian raiding parties. 
 
 In $MONTH$, $YEAR$, the Qing government sent the Mongol General Senggelinqin, who had recently crushed a large Taiping army, to defeat the Nian.
These rebels will be crushed like the rest.

By $YEAR$, the leader of the Nian rebellion, Zhang Lexing and many of his commanders, including his younger brother have been killed or captured. Qing imperial troops had recaptured most Nian territory, the remnants of the Nian were crushed by the combined forces of the government’s troops and the Ever-Victorious Army.

By $YEAR$, despite the best efforts of our navy and army to restore Qing control of China, the rebels of the Taiping Heavenly Kingdom have finally stormed Peking and have deposed the Manchu Emperor and our efforts in the far east are now for naught. There is debate of what course of action we should now take-although the restoration of the Qing Empire is now out of the question, new opportunities may arise over the weakened new Chinese state. 
 
 Firstly, there are still several former breakaway states from the Qing Empire that are still independent of Taiping rule which are ripe for British influence and exploitation. Secondly, several coastal cities of China are still under our influence and control, and under the past treaties with the Qing, these ports have to remain open to foreign trade. 
 
 Now the question is which course should we take-Extending our influence to the breakaway Chinese states, Seizing the coastal ports open to foreign trade, or make peace with the new Chinese Kingdom?
Extend our support to the breakaway states
We shall do both, seize the cities and declare our support for the breakaway states.
Make peace and normalize relations with the Taiping.

With the fall of the Qing Empire, our new nation is now finally free from Manchu rule. However, the freedom we fought so hard for from the Manchu may be once again be threaten by Taiping rule in China. British diplomats have proposed that we sign a treaty of friendship and allow British advisors in our courts and give British subjects extraterritoriality. Should we side with the British to maintain our independence, or should we reunite with China?
We shall sign the treaty with the British
Our struggle was only against the Manchu.

The cowardly $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have seized the ports of Canton and Ningbo, claiming that the treaties with the now defunct Qing Empire are still valid, and have taken control of these cities to ensure foreign traders can still flock into China. We should act against in retaliation and seize all $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ holdings in our lands, however our armies have been devasted in the fight against the Manchu, and another costly war may be undesirable.
Our Heavenly Kingdom will prevail against the foreign aggressors!
We will reclaim these territories in time when we are ready.

The British government has approached us with an interesting proposal, in light of the collapse of the Ottoman Dynasty, Turkish ability to hold to the Arab provinces is severely weakened. The British have proposed that the Arab provinces be split into two spheres of influence-France will control of south-eastern Turkey, northern Iraq, Syria and Lebanon while Britain would be allocated control of the areas roughly comprising the coastal strip between the Mediterranean Sea and the River Jordan, Jordan, southern Iraq, and an additional small area that included the ports of Haifa and Acre, to allow access to the Mediterranean. \n \n If we were to agree to this proposal, we would quickly find ourselves at war with the Turks.
We refuse to partake in this senseless war.
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Government has agreed to the proposal, our troops will be mobilized and deployed to the Orient at once.
This will be a pleasant little war.
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Government has rejected our proposal and refuse to participate in the partitioning of Turkey, what course of action should we take now?
Then we will have the whole region to ourselves!
Call off our plans, we cannot do this alone.

There has been a plot by the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ to partition our nation by seizing the Arab province, and reports of $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ warships and troops leaving port and setting sail towards the Orient. What course of action should we take?
If it’s a war they want...
We cannot afford another war, give in to their demands...

Like vultures the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have descended upon us. We have been forced to the bargaining table to accept humiliating terms of the Treaty of Sevres regarding the breakup and partitioning of our great nation. This is a moment that shall be remembered in $COUNTRY$ for years to come.
We have little choice but to accept their demands...
We have received our territories as per the Asia Minor Agreement

The territories of the Left Bank of the Rhine, which French troops had conquered in 1795, had been returned to German (mostly Prussian) control after the 1815 Congress of Vienna, forming the Rhine Province. On $YEAR$, France shifted its focus to the Rhine, and the French government, led by Adolphe Thiers, restated its claim to the areas on the left bank, to re-establish the Rhine as a natural border. \n \n The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has called for German unity against a second French threat.
The Rhine is German! We will ally with Prussia!

During the Austro-Prussian War Brother’s War, Napoleon III promised the Prussian Prime Minister, Otto von Bismarck, of France’s neutrality, hoping that such an open statement of intent would strengthen France’s negotiating position regarding the western bank of the Rhine. Bismarck refused to offer any land from the Rhineland, which was Napoleon’s preferred region. However, he did make suggestions of French hegemony in Belgium and Luxembourg, although not committing anything to writing. \n \n Napoleon III has offered the Netherlands 50,000 guilders for Luxembourg. Being in deep financial trouble, the Netherlands accepted the offer. News of this purchase has caused nationalist fervour and public outcry across Germany we must decide what position $COUNTRY$ stands on the purchase.

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has objected to the sale of Luxembourg to $COUNTRY$, the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has threatened war if the sale were still to go through. However, they are willing to come to an acceptable compromise that leaves Luxembourg a part of neither country, leaving us with a possible face-saving outcome.
A war must be avoided, we must find a compromise

Although public outcry throughout much of Germany objected our actions, the government of $FROMCOUNTRY$ has not objected to the purchase of Luxembourg, the sale will go through and the territory will be incorporated into France immediately.
The Luxembourg Crisis-$FROMCOUNTRY$ accepts the purchase

With the German public angered and an impasse developing, Napoleon III sought to backtrack-he certainly did not want to appear to be unduly expansionist to the other Great Powers. Thus, he demanded only that Prussia withdraw its soldiers from Luxembourg City, threatening war in the event that Prussia did not comply. Tsar Alexander II of Russia called for an international conference, to be held in London. The United Kingdom was more than happy to host the talks as the British government feared that the absorption of Luxembourg by either power would weaken Belgium, a useful buffer between Germany and France.
The Luxembourg Crisis-The Treaty of London

Despite our objections and attempts at meditation for a peaceful outcome, the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ has pushed through the sale and has annexed Luxembourg regardless of the will of the international community. This leaves us without a choice but to go to war to liberate the people of Luxembourg from French rule.

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has proclaimed that the region of Wallonia is a rightful part of France and has stated its intention to seize the region by force if necessary, we must either look to the great powers to defend us from a French invasion, or we could surrender the region to avoid a costly war.
We cannot possibly defeat the French, we will secede the region.

France has proclaimed that the region of Wallonia is a rightful part of France and has stated its intention to seize the region by force if necessary, $FROMCOUNTRY$ has requested that we intervene and form an alliance in the event of a French invasion.
The Walloon Crisis-$FROMCOUNTRY$ Requests for our aid!

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has request aid for the other Great Powers of Europe, the two best courses of action is to swiftly strike the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ before the other European powers are ready to support them, or two back down and give up our claims to the region.
The Walloon Crisis-$FROMCOUNTRY$ calls for international intervention!
French unity will not be stopped.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has backed down, and have renounced their claims on the region of Wallonia, the Walloon Crisis has ended in our favour, and another European war has been averted

With the victory of the Carlists and the crowning of Carlos V as King of Spain. Once of his first declarations is that he intends to return ‘rightful’ Spanish rule to its former colonies once more. This is a concerning development, we should be prepared to fight for our freedoms once more.
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ will not set foot in the New World!

Many of our citizens have begun to blame our nations woes and failures on internal sabotage by the Jewish people, their shops have been attacked, their places of worship burn, many are calling for our government to revoke the citizenship of the Jewish people in our country.
